articles.title: Crypto.com acquires regulatory license to offer derivatives in the United Arab Emirates
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Crypto.com has acquired a limited license from Dubai's Virtual Asset Regulatory Authority to offer derivatives in the UAE. The firm also acknowledged that the new issuance extended the provisions of its existing VASP license to operate in the region. The crypto trading platform that its new regional entity plans to offer will offer various derivatives products, including futures, perpetual swap contracts, and CFDs.

articles.title: Turkey Tightens Crypto Regulations: CMB Gains Full Control Over Digital Assets
articles.author: 99 Bitcoins

CMB published two regulatory documents concerning 'Establishment and operating principles of Crypto Asset Service' on 13 March 2025.

articles.title: UAE fund ploughs $2bn into Binance crypto exchange
articles.author: News Desk
